contentList.content: Haste
Bonus Action Leveled Spell
Not Bonus Action Leveled Spell
Free Weapon Equip
Can't attune items while in combat
Maximum amount of attuned items
Already concentrating on a spell
Can't target invisible characters

When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

You ignore the loading property of crossbows for the purposes of Extra Attack.

You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if your weapons aren't <LSTag Tooltip="Light">Light</LSTag>, you can equip two weapons for free on your turn instead of one, and you gain a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> while wielding a melee weapon in each hand. You cannot dual-wield <LSTag Tooltip="Heavy">Heavy</LSTag> weapons.
Walk
Long Distance
Second-Story Work
Shield Master (Shove)
Reckless Attack
Resources Blocked
Intangible Summon
Flyby
Crossbow Expert: Loading
Attunement
Concentration Failsafe
You start walking instead of running.
You can use the Bonus Action granted by your Cunning Action to Help allies, Distract enemies or Throw an item, in addition to Dash, Disengage or Hide.
You've mastered the art of falling and gain resistance to Falling damage. Also, you now use your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> to increase your Jumping distance.
If you take the Attack Action on your turn, you can attempt to Shove with your shield using your Bonus Action.

Throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. Attacking recklessly on your first attack of your turn gives you <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on melee weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> using Strength during this turn, but Attack Rolls against you have Advantage until your next turn.
This summon can only act if the Owner uses the Command Spell.
Doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when flying out of an enemy's reach.
You ignore the loading property of crossbows for the purposes of Extra Attack.
This item requires an attunement to be equipped and counts towards the maximum of attuned items.

You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if the weapons you are wielding aren't Light and you can equip two weapons for free on your turn instead of one. You cannot dual-wield <LSTag Tooltip="Heavy">Heavy</LSTag> weapons.
Prevents casting spells that require <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> while concentrating on another spell.
Walking won't reduce the maximum travelled distance in a turn, it's purely cosmetic.
Jump (Thief)
Jump (Cat)
Produce Flame: Hurl (Free)
Jump up, down, and across. Your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> affects how far you can jump.
Hurl a sphere that deals [1] and possibly creates a surface if aiming to the ground. Alternatively, choose a different type of damage.
Hurl caustic energy that damages the target. Creates an <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ACID">Acid</LSTag> surface if aiming to the ground.
Hurl freezing energy that damages the target. Creates a frosty surface to knock creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> if aiming to the ground.
Hurl fiery energy that damages the target. Creates a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> surface if aiming to the ground.
Hurl lightning energy that damages the target. Creates an electrified surface if aiming to the ground.
Hurl poisonous energy that damages the target. Creates a bubbling surface to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag> creatures if aiming to the ground.
Hurl a sphere that deals [1] and possibly creates a surface if aiming to the ground.
End Short Rest
Dodge
Cunning Action
Cunning Action: Hide
Ends the <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> for you and your party members around you.

Until the start of your next turn, any <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> made against you has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>, and you make Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>. You lose this benefit if you are either incapacitated or immobilized.
You can use your Bonus Action to Dash, Disengage or Hide.
Replenish expended <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> during a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>. You cannot restore spell slots above 5th level.
Replenish expended <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> during a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>. You cannot restore spell slots above 5th level.
Prepare to make a volley of thorns the next time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, dealing [1] to it and creatures within [2] of them.
Become Invisible. The spell ends if you attack or cast another spell.
Focus your attention in an attempt to sense nearby <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING">Hidden</LSTag> enemies, possibly spotting them.
Spend [1] ki point to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="RAW_Shout_Dodge">Dodge</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.

Spend [1] ki point to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>. Also doubles your jump distance for this turn.

Spend [1] ki point to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Disengage">Disengage</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>. Also doubles your jump distance for this turn.
Short Rest
Distracted
Stabilized
Commanded
Call Lightning
Hail of Thorns
Bonus Action Spells Rule
Spotted
Taking a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.

Focusing on avoiding attacks.

Attack Rolls against the affected entity have Disadvantage, and the entity has Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.

The status is removed if you're either incapacitated or immobilized.
The next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> not from the Distracted Source is made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.

Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Strength-based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> during their turn. Enemies have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against them.
A stabilized character no longer has to roll Death Saving Throws and will regain [1] after leaving combat.
This summon can act because its Owner commanded it.
While inside the storm, this character can be target by a lightning bolt

Creature has a +2 bonus to Armour Class, Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws, its movement speed is doubled, and it can take one additional action per turn.

When the condition ends, the creature becomes Lethargic.

The extra action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage or Hide.
Next ranged weapon attack deals [1] to target and creatures within [2] of them.
You can't cast leveled spells after you cast a bonus action spell.
You can't cast leveled bonus action spells after casting a leveled spell.
Surrounded by a cloud of nauseating gas.
Lost an action retching and reeling.

Can see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures within [1]. Automatically finds <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAW_INVISIBILITY_SNEAKING_TECHNICAL">Hidden & Invisible</LSTag> enemies inside your vision cone.

Affected entity can't benefit from <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAW_INVISIBILITY_SNEAKING_TECHNICAL">Hidden & Invisible</LSTag> due to the effects of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SeeInvisibility">See Invisibility</LSTag>.

Searching for <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING">Hidden</LSTag> enemies within [1]. Makes a <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> against all hidden enemies' passive <LSTag Tooltip="Stealth">Stealth</LSTag>, revealing the ones won.
Spotted by an enemy using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SeeInvisibility_Seek">Sense Hidden Presence</LSTag>.
Your jump distance is doubled for the turn.
Can make one more unarmed attack as part of your Flurry of Blows.

If you reach 0 hit points, you fall Unconscious and must make Death Saving Throws. On 3 successes, you stop bleeding out and become Stable. On 3 failures, you die.
If you regain any Hit Points, the condition is removed. If an ally <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Help">Helps</LSTag> you and succeeds on their DC 10 <LSTag Tooltip="Medicine">Medicine</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag>, you become stabilized and regain [1] when Out of Combat.
Hidden & Invisible
Entity is completely undetectable by the enemies until it loses its Invisibility or its <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING">Hidden</LSTag> status.

Has Advantage on Attack Rolls and imposes Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Invisibility ends early if the invisible entity attacks or casts another spell.

Affected entity is invisible. It has Advantage on Attack Rolls and imposes Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Invisibility ends early if the invisible entity moves, attacks or casts another spell.

Has Advantage on Attack Rolls and imposes Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Attacking, casting spells, or entering a brightly lit area ends this condition.

Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and imposes <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Affected entity is invisible. It has Advantage on Attack Rolls and imposes Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Attacking, casting spells, or entering a brightly lit area ends this condition.

Has Advantage on Attack Rolls and imposes Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Attacking or casting spells that aren't Shadowslip ends this condition.

Affected entity is invisible. It has Advantage on Attack Rolls and imposes Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible. It has a +[1] bonus to Stealth Checks.

Invisibility ends early if the invisible entity moves, attacks or casts another spell.

Can't move or take actions, bonus actions, or reactions.

Attacks against a Prone creature have Advantage if they're made within [1] of the creature, otherwise they have Disadvantage.

A Prone creature must spend half its Movement Speed to stand up.
Shove (Push)
Shove (Prone)
Distract
Distract (Cunning Action)
Help (Cunning Action)
Command Summon
Feign Death: Dismiss
Shove a target to push it [1].
Shove a target. You can try to push it away or knock it prone.
Shove a target to knock it prone.
Shove a target with your shield. You can try to push it away or knock it prone.

Feint, distract the target, or in some other way team up to make your ally's next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> before your next turn have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Makes a DC 10 <LSTag Tooltip="Medicine">Medicine</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> to stabilize a <LSTag Tooltip="Downed">Downed</LSTag> character.
Use your Bonus Action to command your summon to act.
Put creatures into a magical slumber. Targets in an area are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures), up to a combined of [1].

Creates a storm cloud in the targeted area. Then, you can call down lightning on an area inside the storm striking all targets. For the next 10 turns, you can call down lightning again using an Action.
Dismiss the effects of Feign Death on a creature.

Touch a creature to turn it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>. It has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and imposes <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

Turn a creature <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GREATER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>. It has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and imposes <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Attack Rolls against enemies that can't see invisible.

After taking the Attack action, spend [1] ki point to make two unarmed attacks as a bonus action.
The attacks need not be on the same target.
Kick a target.
Shoving depends on your <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag>, and the higher of the target's Athletics or <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag>.
Removes Burning, Ensnared, Entangled, Enwebbed, Prone, and Sleeping.
Invisibility breaks when you attack or cast another spell.
Throw (Item)
Throw (Cunning Action)
Throw Weapon (Main Hand)
Throw Weapon (Off-Hand)
Throw Weapon (Transition)
Throw an item from the floor or your inventory.

Throw an item from the floor or your inventory, without dealing damage to the target.

Throwable items like grenades will still activate their effects.
Pick up an item and use it to make a melee attack.
<LSTag Tooltip="Thrown">Throw</LSTag> the weapon on your main hand.
<LSTag Tooltip="Thrown">Throw</LSTag> the weapon on your off-hand.
<LSTag Tooltip="Thrown">Throw</LSTag> the weapon that was in your off-hand before you threw the main hand one.
Your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> affects how much weight you can throw. Heavier items deal more damage.
Your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> affects how much weight you can throw.
Attacking further than the normal range ([1] for Javelins and [2] for other weapons) impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Invisibility ends early if you attack or cast another spell.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Invisibility ends early if you move, attack or cast another spell.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Invisibility ends early if you attack, cast another spell or enter a brightly lit area.
